name: CGRectEdge
desc: Coordinates that establish the edges of a rectangle.

items.name: case minXEdge
items.desc: The minimum value for the x-coordinate of the rectangle. In macOS and iOS with the default coordinate system this is the left edge of the rectangle.

items.name: case minYEdge
items.desc: The minimum value for the y-coordinate of the rectangle. In macOS with the default coordinate system this is the bottom edge of the rectangle. In iOS with the default coordinate system this is the top edge of the rectangle.

items.name: case maxXEdge
items.desc: The maximum value for the x-coordinate of the rectangle. In macOS and iOS with the default coordinate system this is the right edge of the rectangle.

items.name: case maxYEdge
items.desc: The maximum value for the y-coordinate of the rectangle. In macOS with the default coordinate system this is the top edge of the rectangle. In iOS with the default coordinate system this is the bottom edge of the rectangle.
